intro: Clidemia heteropila, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, violet-pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous seeds. Clidemia heteropila plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian forests, providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
